title: PHPtouch()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPtouch()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Sets the access and modification time of the specified file:
<?php
filename = "test.txt";
if (touch($filename)) {
echo 
  $filename . " modification time has been changed to present time";
} else {
echo "Sorry, could not change modification time of " . $filename;
}
?>
Definition and Usage
The touch() function sets the access and modification time of the specified file.
Note:
If the specified file does not exist, it will be created.
Syntax
touch(
filename
,
time
,
atime
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
filename
Required. Specifies the file to touch
time
Optional. Sets the touch time. The current system time is set by default
atime
Optional. Sets the access time. Default is the current system time if no parameters are set, or the same as the time parameter if that parameter is set
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE on success, FALSE on 
 failure
PHP Version:
4.0+
PHP Changelog:
PHP 5.3 -

★
+1

quiz.question: What is The current system time?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of The current system time is 'set by default
atime
Optional'.

quiz.question: What is Default is the current system time if no parameters?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of Default is the current system time if no parameters is 'set'.

summary: This tutorial covers PHPtouch()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPtouch()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPtouch()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
